CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 14, 1945, p. 13, reads: Bound For Tuskegee - Thunderbird - Getting set to go aloft into the wild blue yonder, Capt. Charles B. Hall, who is credited with shooting down the first Nazi plane in the European war, waves as he guns his plane for the take-off.  Captain Hall was the 'star' attraction at the Fourth of July celebration at Kennard Field. - Courier Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Captain Charles B. Hall, Tuskegee Airman, waving from U. S. Army airplane
